I've seen this kind of code in a lot of places. It's very interesting, but it's very easy to get the wrong idea about it.
First, the code is a bit tricky to understand. The key to understanding it is the lambda in the key function, which basically says "take the first item in the list, and return it."
Second, the code doesn't really work as-is. You have to change the list in the last line to something like this:
[[], [1], [1, 2, 3]]
The reason is that the second item in the list is not a tuple. So, if you try to return it, it will raise an exception.
